page.title: 18Medical Facilities, Tongue
page.content: One {doctor }has to cover an area of approx 500 sq mls with 2 {District {Nurses}(one shared with neighbouring practice).The number of {patients}pres ently registered is 550-600 concentrat ed in three main areas.{Minor {casualties}can be dealt with in the surgery but the nearest casualty dept is 40 mls away.An ambulance is available from Bettyhill 13mls away. This is used for{emergency & routine} hospital admission.'Red Cross' cars are also available for transport to outpatient clinics or for routine adm ission of ambulant patients.In extreme emergencies, direct admission to hosp ital in Aberdeen or Inverness can be made by calling on an RAF helicopter. A visiting chiropodist consults in the doctor's surgery once a month, and an optician twice a year.
